title: Can we disable exp gain in Dominion? The bots are getting out of hand
body:
Somewhere between 30-50% occurrence in the last 20 games I've ~~played~~ tried to play in champ select (Dodge cause of bots). That's pretty bad. They're super obvious too (no masteries, only play free champs, select ghost/heal summoners).

Yeah I know, Riot doesn't care about dominion etc, etc...

...but might as well try.

Edit: Why my percent is guesswork.

replies.body:
I'm sure there are plenty of other ways to fix the bot problem than disabling experience.

Like honestly, I got through level 10-29 by playing dominion because normals get very painful in the middle. I really do like dominion, but it would feel so shitty to go through an entire game and not receive any experience. I'm already butthurt that Champion Mastery can't be gained there, but thats a different subject.

Also slightly offtopic, what level is the account you're trying to play on? I basically never see bots anymore because I'm always matched with other level 30 players.

I'd be indifferent to the actual solution if they could actually remove the bot problem. But the fact is, Riot has stated they don't have the resources/desire/whatever to support dominion, so removing exp gain is the easiest strategy.

I'm level 30. I'm pretty sure my dominion MMR is too high (hence getting the below 30s). Ranked dominion would solve that problem for me, but we know Riot's stance on that (see above).
I doubt it's a resource thing anyways. Riot is a pretty successful company. They are probably just too lazy to do anything.

Wait a minute, those are BOTS?

And here I was feeling bad for stomping noobs with my friend.

Now that I think about it, whenever I play dominion with my friend (we get bored) I'm pretty sure we're the only humans there.

I literally had the same reaction you just did the first couple of times I played with bots -- I thought they were new players that just needed experience. It's only when someone pointed out that they have certain repetitive behaviors: the most obvious one is that they walk to a point, stall 2 seconds, then try to capture it (not sure why they can't capture it automatically).

Also, 90% of the bots I've seen share the naming convention of two random words.  One's a four-letter word, the other's a three-letter word.  I've got a few screenshots of games where I was the only 'human player' and it's really obvious to pick out the bots.  

I'll post the screenshots later, but I'm on my phone right now and won't be able to get to my computer for a few hours.

And if you play late at night there will be 0 other real people in your game. I really don't know why they haven't created an automated system to detect these accounts. It is insanely obvious and they never seem to get banned (if you look up the accounts you see they will have been playing for weeks/months...etc).
Bots farm IP aswell..

Yep, I agree, but disabling IP would screw over everyone at once, whereas disabling exp would screw over people that are legitimately leveling AND bots.

Unless we could convince Riot to implement a more comprehensive solution, I think disabling exp is the best "band aid" fix.
Captcha every 2-3 games could do the trick too :)

To every player experiencing bots in their matches (on any maps) report them for "feeding" & "third party software" at the end of game lobby.

Afterwards, submit a [request](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) listing the name(s) of the bot(s) and a link to the match they were in. Choose the "General Questions" category. Player Support will understand it's not a question, so no worries.

Riot must have changed the matchmaking formula last patch, because before then I *never* saw a bot in Dominion on account of high MMR.  Now I'm seeing them all the time.  It is *painful* to queue for 15-25 minutes and then have a game ruined by bots.  It's driving people out of the queue either by dodging or going to other maps, which is making the bot problem even *worse*.

A temporary solution would be to make it so level 30s don't get matched with sub-30s.  That wouldn't solve things (lower level players would still have to deal with them) but most of Dominion's dedicated players are long-timers that hit 30 a *long* time ago.

The best solution would be Riot finally sucking it up and having players just start at level 30 from account creation.  As with any illegal product, farmed accounts have demand.  So long as that demand exists people are going to cheat to make money off it.  If Riot destroyed the demand, then the bots would evaporate overnight.
